hints.content:
To find the difference in the pipe lengths, we start with the length of the $\purpleD{\text{palace pipe}}$ and subtract the length of the $\blueE{\text{house pipe}}$.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/16b87c072da3865e8a9420bfcf4afd20d2f2d49d)

$\purpleD{59} \text { ft}-\blueE{36} \text { ft}= \maroonD{\Large\Box} \text{ ft}$

Let's subtract to find the difference.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/908d29bc223e1fc6c07cd2ee0f09e0e8c75a9fed)

$\purpleD{59}\text{ ft}  - \blueE{36}\text{ ft}  = \maroonD{23}\text{ ft}$
The difference in the lengths of the pipes is $\maroonD{23}\text{ ft}$.

question.content:
A water pipe under a palace is $59$ $\text{ft}$ long. A water pipe under a house is $36$ $\text{ft}$ long.  

**What is the difference in the lengths of the two water pipes?**  

[[â˜ƒ numeric-input 1]] $\text{ft}$
